body_html:
Ok, I found the solution. It's apparently the browser (Chrome), which has an expired certificate.

Tensorboard on Windows 10 (bash on ubuntu) works well for me now with the Firefox browser.

One more unrelated thing, though:
The resource: web-animations-next-lite.min.js.map in the /usr/local/lib/python3.4/dist-packages/external/web_animations_js directory seems to be missing in the Windows python 3.4 pip install of tensorflow (I used the https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/cpu/tensorflow-0.8.0-cp34-cp34m-linux_x86_64.whl). I had to manually generate this one file from GitHub. Only after that, all 404 errors disappeared.

body:
Ok, I found the solution. It's apparently the browser (Chrome), which has an expired certificate.

Tensorboard on Windows 10 (bash on ubuntu) works well for me now with the Firefox browser.

One more unrelated thing, though:
The resource: `web-animations-next-lite.min.js.map` in the `/usr/local/lib/python3.4/dist-packages/external/web_animations_js` directory seems to be missing in the Windows python 3.4 pip install of tensorflow (I used the `https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/cpu/tensorflow-0.8.0-cp34-cp34m-linux_x86_64.whl`). I had to manually generate this one file from GitHub. Only after that, all 404 errors disappeared.
